data.name: Chief Analytics Officer
data.description: The chief analytics/data office oversees a range of data-related functions that may include data management, ensuring data quality and creating data strategy. Responsible for data analytics and business intelligence, the process of drawing valuable insights from data and to evolve and govern our data platform and analytics strategy to provide insight into business decisions and improve customer experience. Works closely with stakeholders across the company to expand our data assets and build platforms to make that data more accessible. The successful candidate will have a proven track record leading product and engineering organizations as well as demonstrated commercial acumen.

data.name: Chief Operations Officer
data.description:
The goal of the COO position is to secure the functionality of business to drive extensive and sustainable growth.The COO role is a key member of the senior management team, reporting only to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO).Responsibilities: 
 - Designing and implementing business operations
 - Establishing policies that promote company culture and vision
 - Overseeing operations of the company and the work of executives
 - Business Development in order to both grow the company in the present, but more important to develop a business development team

data.name: Client Services Manager
data.description: The Customer Services Manager facilitates the efficient operation of the assigned department by performing a variety of clerical and administrative tasks.

data.name: Client Services Specialist
data.description: The Customer Services Specialist facilitates the efficient operation of the assigned department by performing a variety of clerical and administrative tasks.  The Customer Services Specialist is responsible for daily oversight of the functions of the assessment process, to support health plan requests and support therapists/reviewers.

data.name: Clinical Reviewer Journey
data.description: Reports to National Director. Responsible for review and executive summary write-up for each in-home assessment, tele-health session, or chart review.  Will attend state fair hearings.  Will work with Field clinicians in any necessary format to improve work product, clarification, and training both at the granular/request level and in support of company initiatives.

data.name: Chief Medical Officer
data.description: The CMO works with the company executive team to develop and facilitate execution of the company vision and strategy.  The CMO plays a key role in the management of current state and the development of new opportunities with current clients.  Additionally, identification of  prospective opportunities and customers with the CEO and COO as well as oversight of the clinical and IT team and facilitation and ensure effective delivery of the service.

data.name: Clinical National Director
data.description: Reports to C-level Team.  Responsible to understand the vision and strategy of the company and effectively communicating the vision and strategy to the clinical team.  Identifies challenges to the delivery system and works with leadership to develop solutions.  Identifies top performers and works to position them for future opportunities.  Monitor key legislative national and regional initiatives/changes and develop a communication and training strategy to address national and regional legislative changes, which impact our service delivery.  Coordinate clinical webinar strategy for both National Reviewer and Clinical Teams and work with Clinical Trainers on training.

data.name: Clinical Regional Director
data.description: Reports to National Director and CMO.  Works with ND and CMO Responsible to understand the vision and strategy of the company and effectively communicating the vision and strategy to their regional clinical team.  Identifies challenges to the delivery system and works with leadership to develop solutions.  Identifies top performers within region and works to position them for future opportunities.  Monitor key legislative initiatives/changes and develop a communication and training strategy to address  regional legislative changes, which impact our service delivery.  Coordinate clinical webinar strategy for both National Reviewer and Clinical Teams and work with Clinical Trainers on training.

data.name: Clinical Reviewer
data.description: Reports to National Director. Responsible for review and executive summary write-up for each in-home assessment, tele-health session, or chart review.  Will attend state fair hearings.  Will work with Field clinicians in any necessary format to improve work product, clarification, and training both at the granular/request level and in support of company initiatives.

data.name: Clinical State Champion
data.description: Reports to Regional Director and ND; CMO as needed.  Responsible to understand the vision and strategy of the company and effectively communicate the vision and strategy to their state clinical team.Identifies challenges to the delivery system and works with leadership to develop solutions.Identifies top performers within region and works to position them for future opportunities.Monitor key legislative initiatives/changes and develop a communication and training strategy to address  state legislative changes, which impact our service delivery.  Coordinate clinical webinar strategy for both National Reviewer and Clinical Teams and work with Clinical Trainers on training.

data.name: Clinical Trainer
data.description: Overlap Position reports to C-Level Team to develop training and learning management strategy (LMS).  Works directly with entire Clinical Team to develop content and monitors uptake, progress of LMS.

data.name: Field Clinician
data.description: Reports directly to State Champion; Regional Director when necessary.  Is assigned in-home/on-site assessments.  Is responsible to maintain and update their account record in a timely fashion, which items related to Payroll, Contact, Compliance, etc. Is reposnsible to communicate with our customer service specialists regarding availability and challenges regarding assignments.  Must adhere to client mandated timelines when accepting a request for their service.

data.name: Caregiver / Client
data.description: Individual may view available servicesRequest available servicesTrack Progress of requested/scheduled/provided servicesView and download final reportsCommunicate with client support servicesPay for Services

data.name: Member/Caregiver
data.description: Ability to login and scheduled date, status of their specific request and submit time and date stamped communication to our customer service specialist team.

data.name: Chief Data Officer
data.description: Responsible for Data Governance strategy and implementation of formalized Data Governance Framework

data.name: Chief Information Officer
data.description: Responsibilities - Setting objectives and strategies for the IT department - Selecting and implementing suitable technology to streamline all internal operations and help optimize their strategic benefits - Designing and customizing technological systems and platforms to improve customer experienceThe responsibiltiy is to ensure that information technology adds the maximum value to our company so as to facilitate the success of our business.Goals-Create high performing, cross-functional teams in four disciplines: Development, Engineeering, Customer Care and Operations-Ensure technology stack and resources support ever-changing business goals related to revenue, product, growth, capabilities and customer value.-Create and adhere to compliance laws and policies that impact security, privacy and business processes-Design 5 IT processes to facilitate service delivery, technical support, operations and maintenance.-Maintain stewardship of all IT related assets and resources by focusing on cost containment and high quality services while increasing IT capabilities.LikesFunctional processes that help internal and external customers.Self-organized team members that think aheadTeam members that follow policy and processTransparency with work, agile, devops and happy peopleDislikesKnowitall people that interupt others, that don't listen and have negative outlookTeam members that don't follow process and policyData-driven decisions without the data

data.name: Accounting Manager
data.description:
The Accounting manager is responsible for daily oversight of financial matters and accounting functions of the company.This leadership also engages with senior leadership to make policy recommendations and ensures that the company's financial health is protected by adherence to those polices as well as external guidance and adherence to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).This position also includes a part time schedule as one of the members of the customer services team.The administrative team facilitates the efficient operation of the assigned department by performing a variety of clerical and administrative tasks.Responsibilities:- Daily cash posting and oversight bank reconciliations
 - Accounts receivable management and oversight 
 - Financial reports and insights on accounting matters
 - Timely communications to company's senior leadership about trends as well as matters of concern. Provide administrative support on the West Coast for the admin team.

data.name: Bookeeping
data.description:
The Bookkeeper's responsibilities are to accurately record all day-to-day financial transactions of our company:Record day to day financial transactions and complete the posting process
 - Verify that transactions are recorded in the correct day book, suppliers ledger, customer ledger and general ledger
 - Bring the books to the trial balance stage
 - Enter data, maintain records and create reports and financial statements
 - Evenutally, process accounts receivable/payable and handle payroll in a timely manner
 - Eventually complete tax forms

data.name: Chief Financial Officer
data.description:
As part of an executive management team, the CFO will have interaction with various members of a company, both senior and junior.Responsibilities:
 - Providing leadership, direction and management of the finance and accounting team
 - Providing strategic recommendations to the CEO and members of the executive management team
 - Managing the processes for financial forecasting and budgets, and overseeing the preparation of all financial reporting
 - Advising on long-term business and financial planning
 - Reviewing all formal finance, HR and IT related procedures

data.name: HP Champion
data.description:
Responsible for:
 - Liaising with our company management and training teams
 - Training their staff
 - Creating, request activation, deleting their staff from our system
 - Re-assigning assessments from deleted staff to active staff
 - Update information related to routing of routine functions (invoices, statistical/outcomes reports, clinical reports)
